entries.meaning: (biology) The local fusion of the embryonic stage of an animal to its parent for physiological exchange to promote the growth and development of the young; involves a placenta in non-egglaying mammals.
(botany) The manner in which the seeds are attached to the placenta within the ovary locules.
examples: Parietal placentation occurs in the Brassicaceae family.
Hyponyms: parietal placentation, axile placentation, free central placentation
